result.execSummary:
The defendant Tracy L Erke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 42 Days.
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Substance Abuse Programs.
Concurrent with: Waukesha County Case #14CF392.

miscConds.notes:
Cost and Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation or Extended Supervision at the rate of $75.00 per month starting 02-01-2015.

 If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

Fine of $192.00, DNA Surcharge of $200.00, Blood Reimbursement of $35.00 and Restitution in the amount of $3943.61 to be paid from Case #14CF392 as a Condition of Probation or Extended Supervision on this Case #14CF964.

timeConds.notes: Each year of Probation with the Last 20 hours to be completed within the First 10 months of the last year.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tracy L Erke

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 12/14/16 received a letter from DOA-Collections - Tracy L Erke passed away on 9/18/15 - no estate or beyond claim
Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant Deceased

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.

Defendant Tracy L Erke in court, in custody, with attorney Tony Rosario for  M Elizabeth Weathers.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested.   Preliminary time limits are tolled. Defense presents bail motion arguments. State presents arguments.  Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 11:00 am.
